intro: Canthium spirostylum, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Canthium spirostylum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
